meanings.definition: Relating to a cadastre or land registry.
meanings.sent1: The cadastrally marked map showed all the land boundaries clearly.
meanings.sent2: The cadastrally registered properties were easily identified by their unique codes.
meanings.sent3: The cadastrally organized event ensured that every inch of the land was accounted for.
meanings.sent4: Her cadastrally precise measurements left no room for error in the land survey.
meanings.sent5: The cadastrally accurate records were crucial for resolving property disputes.

meanings.definition: In a manner related to land surveys and property boundaries.
meanings.sent1: He walked cadastrally around the property to ensure accurate measurements.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor marked the boundaries cadastrally to avoid any confusion.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors looked cadastrally at each other, wondering where the property line lay.
meanings.sent4: She danced cadastrally through the fields, imagining the invisible lines beneath her feet.
meanings.sent5: The drone flew cadastrally above, capturing the exact layout of the land.
